newsitem.title: USA: U.S. spot propane drifts lower, trade quiet.
newsitem.headline: U.S. spot propane drifts lower, trade quiet.

text.p: U.S. spot propane prices drifted lower in quiet trade late on Friday as many players left early for the weekend, traders said.
In Mont Belvieu, Texas, propane fell a half cent to between 51.25 cents and 51.50 cents a gallon in quiet activity.
Conway, Kansas, hub spot material, which traded early on at 53.75 and 53.50 cents, dipped down to 53.25/53.50 cents, players said.
Belvieu purity ethane, however, was reported still strong at 31.25/31.50 with ethane mix a penny under.
Conway ethane traded at 28.50 cents and quarter gain from midday.
Traders said many players left their offices early for an industry-sponsored outing over the weekend.
-- Laney Salisbury, New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1631
